definition: to nip/to grasp with the fingers/to fiddle with/Taiwan pr. [nian2]
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to take possession of/to occupy/to take up
lit. to pick the flowers and trample the grass (idiom)/fig. to womanize/to frequent brothels/to sow one's wild oats
see 拈花惹草[nian1 hua1 re3 cao3]
lit. to stretch a hand and grab it (idiom)/fig. easy to do
a snap of the fingers/a short moment/in a flash/in the twinkling of an eye

sentences.english: But Xuande had noticed Cai Mao reaching for his bow and arrow, so he hurriedly headed his horse southwest and rode off.
sentences.chinese: 玄德见瑁手将拈弓取箭，乃急拨马望西南而去。

definition: the final (of a syllable) (Chinese phonology)/rhyme/appeal/charm/(literary) pleasant sound
a snap of the fingers/a short moment/in a flash/in the twinkling of an eye
(literary) to end/to stop/one of the stanzas (usually two) of a ci poem 詞|词[ci2]/classifier for songs or ci poems
abbr. for 七言律詩|七言律诗, verse form consisting of 8 lines of 7 syllables, with rhyme on alternate lines
to search for the right word (of poet)
